four words:
scaling damage laser turrets.

They need buffs right now. They are just way to weak overall compared to champions. Everyone can shred towers and the ones who are designed for it do it like 10x faster while they are two weak to actually be a threat for tower dives. They need some major help.
I want a replay of Veigar tanking 7 tower shots at level 9. I bet nobody will show me that.
Since there is the practice mode to get a complete tank build even at level 9, that shouldn't be that hard to accomplish.

Don't even need to use practice mode.

A high end Veigar player at ten minutes (with no kills but not needing to back) could reasonably expect to have somewhere in the vicinity of 150-175 AP from his passive. That takes an enemy that's constantly getting hit as well as properly CSing with Baleful Strike. This same Veigar will hit level 9 just after the 10m mark, so we'll use level 8 for these calculations.

Let's say our Veigar backs and picks up a Morellonomicon and maybe some boots. That'll bring him up to about 275AP on the high end, and since mpen is popular, we'll assume he's running sorc boots and some flat penetration runes. Call it 35 mpen.

At level 8, Veigar has 66 base AD against 38% reduction for 41 physical damage. He also does 110 magic damage, after factoring in the half scaling and magic penetration. Each autoattack against the turret thus does 151 damage, or roughly 4.3% of its maximum health.

Veigar doesn't fare anywhere near as well.

With 966 health and only 24% reduction from armor against turret shots thanks to their 30% penetration, the first turret shot against Veigar will do 146 damage to him - roughly 15% of his maximum health. This ramps up on a per-shot basis, and since there's nobody to swap off of him, it will quickly kill him.

The first shot does about 15% of his total health.
The second does about 20%.
The third will do 28% of his health.
The fourth will do 35% of his health. This leaves him at about 2% of original HP.
The fifth shot ramps differently, and only does 41% of his health, but it's still massive overkill.

In this time, he'd get somewhere between four and five autoattacks off, so in exchange for his entire health pool he'd knock off maybe a fifth of the turret's health.

In short, unless he got Zhonya's as a first buy and blew summoners, he's not tanking seven turret shots.

"A high end Veigar player at ten minutes (with no kills but not needing to back) could reasonably expect to have somwhere in the vicinity of 150-175 AP from his passive"



You have literally no idea what you're talking about. You would expect 150 AP from a very fed veigar at 15 minutes (lots of kills/assists).


At 10 mins you can reasonably expect a Veigar to have 60-70 bonus AP.


By 10 minutes into the game you wouldn't of even had 150 minions spawn that you could kill with Q.



Edit: Also, Veigar starting catalyst/seeker + having armor runes would survive much longer, and it's a perfectly good build vs certain matchups

Veigar gets stacks in the following ways:

1. He gets 5 when he takes down an enemy champion.
2. He gets 1 when he lands any ability on an enemy champion.
3. He gets 1 for every minion slain with Baleful Strike.
4. He gets 2 for every large minion slain with Baleful Strike.

At the 10 minute mark, you've had about 17 waves and your 18th wave will spawn at the 10:15 mark. If Veigar farms carefully, he could use his Q up to three times per wave, granting as much as a hundred AP by ten minutes. Between careful Q usage and double stacks from large minions, it's entirely possible get a hundred stacks from minions. Getting the remaining fifty from spell hits on enemy champions is a tall order - for mana reasons if nothing else - but it's possible, especially if your jungler gives you blue buff.

Is it optimistic? Certainly, and I don't really expect most Veigar players to get anywhere close to that, and if they do, they almost certainly have some kills to show for it. But it's not completely unobtainable.

"a high end veigar could REASONABLY expect.."


This is where you're wrong. You cannot reasonably expect to have that much AP. You can't reasonably expect that your opponent will let one of the weakest laners in the game have perfect CS.


The only real way you can get that much AP is if you get tons of takedowns.



Generally Veigars will miss shit tons of CS because their opponent will just constantly shove it into the tower, or bully them out of lane.
